The Data Science Africa network is holding its second conference. In 2015 we held the conference in Kenya at Dedan Kimathi University, Kenya (see last year’s conference programme). This year we’re back in Uganda at Makerere University, Kampala from 27th June to 1st July, 2016.

We start the event with a two or three day summer school in machine learning, followed by regional and international researchers presenting work in the field of data science in Africa.

This conference is organised by Neil Lawrence, Mike Smith, Ernest Mwebaze, Mubangizi Martin Gordon, John Quinn, Mike Croucher, .

Draft Schedule

27th, 28th, 29th June

Machine Learning summer school

30th June and 1st July

Two day workshop for data science in Africa.
